qas.question: Peter Bradshaw held what position in youtube?
What type of videos did youtube officially start supporting in July 2009?
What is the name for the common method of viewing a 3d movie, with red and blue glasses?
When did HTML5 officially support side-by-side 3D footage?

plausible_answers.text: YouTube users can now upload 3D videos

qas.question: What was announced by Peter Bradshaw on May 21, 2009?

plausible_answers.text: side-by-side 3D footage that is compatible with Nvidia 3D Vision.

qas.question: What did YouTube begin supporting in July 2011?

plausible_answers.text: common anaglyph (cyan/red lens) method which utilizes glasses worn by the viewer to achieve the 3D effect

qas.question: What ways can all YouTube videos be viewed?

context: In a video posted on July 21, 2009, YouTube <a0_0>software engineer<a0_0/> Peter Bradshaw announced that <b4_0>YouTube users can now upload <a1_0>3D<a1_0/> videos<b4_0/>. The videos can be viewed in several different ways, including the <b6_0>common <a2_0>anaglyph<a2_0/> (cyan/red lens) method which utilizes glasses worn by the viewer to achieve the 3D effect<b6_0/>. The YouTube Flash player can display stereoscopic content interleaved in rows, columns or a checkerboard pattern, side-by-side or anaglyph using a red/cyan, green/magenta or blue/yellow combination. <a3_0>In May 2011<a3_0/>, an HTML5 version of the YouTube player began supporting <b5_0>side-by-side 3D footage that is compatible with Nvidia 3D Vision.
